Name: Shabti of Ankhpefhery
Description: Crudely incised moulded faience shabti of a man named Ankhpefhery (meaning 'May his master live !'). The incised detail includes the pick and hoe, and basket slung over left shoulder; there is an uninscribed back pillar, and five lines of hieroglyphic text in which the figure is summoned to answer for Ankhpefhery if ever he is called to hard labour in the next life.
